line_1: And homage takes from every quarter,
line_2: E'en from the peasant to the garter.

line_1: And your VAN-BRUG had found no Quarter,
line_2: But for his dabbling in the Morter.

line_1: The Fool whose Wife elopes some thrice a quarter,
line_2: For matrimonial Solace dies a martyr.

line_1: And cry to heedless Time for quarter —
line_2: Am not reduc'd those charms to barter,
